name: tri-n-butyl phosphate
Reason: 1,3,5-Trimethyl-2-imidazolidine has a melting point of -109.4 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for our comparison will be ethane, which has a melting point of -172.0 degrees Celsius. The structural modifications we need to consider are the presence of three additional phenyl groups. Phenyl groups, when connected to a benzene ring, tend to increase the melting point due to the enhancement of the crystalline structure and the increase in molecular weight. In the case of tri-n-butyl phosphate, we have three additional phenyl groups linked in a linear fashion, which would notably augment the melting point. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight.
